item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7074] ArcGIS JavaScript dateline problems causing WMS Layers to not Render Correctly on 2D Map
item.description:
1. Launch DCGS-N 2D Map. Also launch 3D map since it works fine and no dateline issue and this serves as a baseline to test 2D map.
  2. Launch MTC2 METOC and select Natural Earth layer since it gives a global WMS layer.
  1. Click 'png' Basemap Layer Group (this is how the WMS should be rendered on Map with the color teal over the sea)
  2. Click 'map it' Basemap Layer Group
  3. DCGS-N 2D Map renders the WMS without the teal regions

The Basemap Layer Group renders correctly on the 3D map.

  • FNMOC NPS Configuration Issue: The WMS renders a default image on the 2D map EPSG:3395, brown with no water (ie: Natural Earth, Basemap Layer Group) when the WMS could not be rendered.
  • This is not an ESRI Map bug. ESRI is requesting a valid OGC WMS request of a well known grid.
  • Note: The Cesium 3D map is able to render the tiled WMS on EPSG:4326 where width and length is 256 by 256.

=========================================================
Some analysis with Jeff Herman yields the following assesments

  1. See the ticket-7074-pic1 attachment for the layer we are rendering
  2. When we zoom in close (ticket-7074-pic2 attachment), the land is rendered correctly, but the 2D map does not render water to blue.
  3. When we zoom out ((ticket-7074-pic3 attachment), the 3D map picks up the correct higher-altitude layer and renders it correctly, but the 2D map does not seem to pick up the higher-altitude layer

There are 3 issues

  1. The 2D map does not paint the water correctly - regardless of altitude?
  2. At higher altitude, the 2D map does not pick up the correct layer. Jeff thinks there is a "flag" that the map can set when the 2D map processes the CMAPI event to load a layer. This flag tells the 2D map to uses different layer based on altitude.
  3. There is a 2D map date line issue. Not sure if this has anything to do with #1 and #2
item.summary: ArcGIS JavaScript dateline problems causing WMS Layers to not Render Correctly on 2D Map

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: According to Jonathan D. he believes ESRI 2D map code is working correctly. It could be the NPS METOC geoserver not serving up correct data.
Work around is to pan opposite direction.

Items 1 and 2 in the description were determined to not be bugs. So item 3 is the only issue here. Esri (Curt Hammill) has acknowledged this is a bug with their JavaScript library we are using for our CJMTK-based map. It’s not scheduled for a fix until July so Curt will try to accelerate it within Esri to meet our 18 APR AISIT date. I requested NLT 11 APR so UFS has time to test and integrate the fix.
Assuming Esri delivers a fix, UFS would need 5 remaining "points". This might be high but there is uncertainty in what they will give us.

Spoke with Curt Hammill this morning.

This fix is targeted for javascript client version 3.17. Version 3.16 was released March 2016. Version 3.17 is supposed to be version 3.16+ this fix only. The current targeted release date for version 3.17 is 15 June 2016. However this release date is only the current status and not set in stone

It was realized that this date is cutting it short for integration w/ Aeolus and updating the software installed on the TW hardware. One suggestion was made in support of decreasing risk would be to upgrade Aeolus from v3.12 to v3.16 now, then the time required upgrade to 3.17 would be shorter.

The physical ship installation of HW is currently targeted for 6/15. The week of 6/20 would likely be the 1st week that we could start regression testing and applying patches to software.
We requested that the date for delivery be 10JUN if at all possible. Curt Hammill was taking the request to the ESRI Development Team and will get back to us as soon as he can.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 2 - Defect results in severely impaired functionality.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7186] S2A Transactions - mda-tracker java Out of Memory Errors
item.description: While attempting to run the AUXTRACKS function of Mongoose (the mda-tracker VM), the java process crashes with a Java outOfMemoryException. This is preventing further transactions from being processed by the system
item.summary: S2A Transactions - mda-tracker java Out of Memory Errors

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
A troubleshooting session was conducted with remote support from Charles Walden (S2A).

To attempt to overcome this issue, we tried to add -Xmx 60g to the JVM arguments in order to force Java to recognize more available memory.

During three failed attempts, we monitored memory consumption in real time and noticed that the system's (mda-tracker) free memory never fell below 100G.
Down graded to Pri 3, added memory as a work around (128G) (Ref D.).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 3 - Defect causes failure of noncritical aspects of the system.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7338] Organic Alert Detection (CEP) work only once for single track
item.description:
When a track enters an active watchbox and alert is generated and is visible in the Alert Preview. When the same track moves outside of the watchbox and reenter the same active watchbox, no alert is generated. We need to investigate the complex event processor (CEP) to see if it's working correctly.

Here is a scenario
1. create a watchbox and set it active
2. Use OTM to move a track into watchbox and verify it generates an alert. This is good.
3. move the track outside of watchbox
4. Use OTM to move the SAME track into the same watchbox, no alert is generated as it should. Moving a different track into the watchbox works fine.
item.summary: Organic Alert Detection (CEP) work only once for single track

comments.comment: Much of the original CEP code that checked for Display rules no longer works with the new rules and datasources. Recommend that this ticket be consumed by ticket DCGSNSAFE-7344.
This ticket just needs about an hour of testing. Last week MPS was not working. This morning (4/4) Kafka and the SO topic is not working. Data Team is looking at this.
Fixed as a part of DCGSNSAFE-7344

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 3 - Defect causes failure of noncritical aspects of the system.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7344] Update organic CEP code to fix rule processing bugs
item.description:
The organic CEP rule processor (ufs-watchbox-geo-query), is not robust and no longer processes the display rule selections from the watchbox. (Jeff found this bug)

For example, if the rule is looking for stockPhotoUrl, and that information does not exist, the code throws an exception instead of catching this and moving on.

The ideal solution would be to make a call to MPS to perform the Display Rule check.

Also, the CEP needs to be regression tested to verify that updated tracks are being received.

Finally, add a configuration to turn on or off the organic CEP processing
item.summary: Update organic CEP code to fix rule processing bugs

comments.comment: Update the CEP processing to call MPS for the CEP check (once I get the REST call parameters from Dale!).

The long term solution is that UFS watchbox-geo-query will query Weaver or MPS to ask if which display rule that Track X meets.

Neither MPS or weaver has this functionality to date. The decision for the interim fix will be to mimic Aeolus. On the map, every time a filter is clicked, Aeolus calls MPS twice: once to set the new filter configuration and then again to 'load features'

This solution will allow the rules to change and still be evaluated correctly until such time that MPS and/or weaver have implemented the long term solution.

So the fix will be:
For each track that comes in:
for each watchbox that is enabled
if(display rule filters enabled and we do not have display rule information on this track)
call MPS twice to see what rule the track matches.
MPS will return information in the ID as to rule this matches
if(track matches watchbox display rule filters)
check to see if it is in the watchbox
if (track is in watchbox)
generate alert.
This ticket just needs about an hour of testing. Last week MPS was not working. This morning (4/4) Kafka and the SO topic is not working. Data Team is looking at this.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 3 - Defect causes failure of noncritical aspects of the system.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-2765] Enhance Configurator to allow retrieving multiple entries in single ajax call
item.description:
currently if you need to retrieve many settings (say 10) from the configuration, you need to send 10 ajax which is not efficient. We want to have a single ajax call where the client can select all 10 settings.

Most of the async calls occur in aeolus in the aeolus-mtc2-config.js file. This causes the map to load more slowly. Implementing this ticket will reduce the number of async calls to 1, thus reducing the map's load time.

Even though this ticket is marked as Improvement, I think its a very important improvement in improving UX. The user will see a significant improvement of widget load time since a widget just need to wait for 1 REST call, instead of a possible 5 or 10+. It also make coding much easier and more maintainable.

The fix would to create a new REST end point in the configurator that takes in an array of keys and return as array of values.
item.summary: Enhance Configurator to allow retrieving multiple entries in single ajax call

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 3 - Defect causes failure of noncritical aspects of the system.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7209] Put update-badges on Alerts and Notes halo icons
item.description: When DCGSNSAFE-7197 is complete, there will be two new halo icons/bubbles: Alerts and Notes. We need badges on them to indicate how many new alerts or notes have come in since last acknowledgement. Start with Alerts since this is well understood with the Inc2 alerting framework (Notes are still not persisted and are bleeding-edge at the moment). I think CGSS (Weaver) will need to query the alert-framework to dynamically create the halo icon with the badge included??
item.summary: Put update-badges on Alerts and Notes halo icons

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: this requires some collaboration with other folks before an accurate estimation can be made. So I'm skipping this estimation for now.
Waiting on SoarTech for documentation now slated for April. Will attempt to proceed starting next week by short phone support (30 minute sessions) from SoarTech.

21 March 2016:

Had 30 min call with SoarTech folks.
Notes and provided documentation tracked on confluence page:

https://rite.sd.spawar.navy.mil/confluence/display/DCGSNEXT/Weaver+Badges+-+Custom+Halo+Icons

Attempting steps 1 & 2 as listed on documentation.
Attached is a sample svg for the new halo icon. Would like some feedback as to how it should look.

Daniel, I suggest that the background of the number of Alerts/Notes (The circle) have a different color. I would not use Red or Green though. Looks good to me for what we need now, this should allow the Warfighter to provide us feedback on how they want it to look. Good job...
Daniel, Looks good to me... We'll see what Jeff Herman says...
I recommend we be consistent with the update-badge styling used for the notification icon in OWF. red circle with white text
I'm good with that... For this round anyway, that being FCR-0.

Published new halo icon; can be seen by hitting this URL:

https://dcgsn-d-web1.sd.spawar.navy.mil:8443/weaver/pm/apps/icons/policies/hex-badge

Rest endpoints for the badge have been created, and can be tested on d-web3 by hitting the following URIs:

NOTES:
"https://dcgsn-d-portal1.sd.spawar.navy.mil/ufs-portrayal-crud/rest/getTrackNotesSince/

{trackId}/{date}/"

This will return the number of notes in accumulo with trackId={trackId}

and date >

{date}
e.x. https://dcgsn-d-portal1.sd.spawar.navy.mil/ufs-portrayal-crud/rest/getTrackNotesSince/4b6144e3-2bbb-45df-a5b6-2d7e55d62721/1420070400000/

ALERTS:
"https://dcgsn-d-web3.sd.spawar.navy.mil:9443/ufs-alert-service/alerts/rest/queryAlertsSince/{resipient}/{trackId}/{date}

/"

This will return the number of active alerts for trackId=

{trackId}

, and recipient=

{recipient}

and date >

{date}

e.x. https://dcgsn-d-web3.sd.spawar.navy.mil:9443/ufs-alert-service/alerts/rest/queryAlertsSince/MONTANEZ.DANIEL.JAY%20WILLIAM.1509833253/fbb86deb-9361-44f0-a60a-630013be3b2c/1458259200000/

Received some insight from SoarTech yesterday, that I am on the right track; and, I have a way forward for building a data-conenctor and testing the new icon policies.

Once this is complete, the final steps will be to make the icon available in the Display Rule Editor, and persisting a "last-checked" date.

Proof of concept data connector working. Can be seen by hitting:

https://dcgsn-d-web1.sd.spawar.navy.mil:8443/weaver/pm/apps/icons/render?iconId=hex-badge&source=notes&recipient=MONTANEZ.DANIEL.JAY%20WILLIAM.1509833253&trackId=4b6144e3-2bbb-45df-a5b6-2d7e55d62721&_accept=image/png

TODO:
Address return type of REST calls to be JSONObject. This will remove the double quotes around the number.
Persist last-checked date.
Pull domain from context.
Daniel, Thanks... Keep working this hard....

No received documentation today.

I made my own implementation of click persistence, that stores a last clicked timestamp in postgres.

Now when we get documentation on how to add the icon to the DRE, we will have all the pieces to make this work; they will just need to be pieced together.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7287] DRADIS: OTM ingest breaks Streaming DPF topology
item.description:
THIS IS NOT RELATED TO THE DPF PERFORMANCE PATCH
This behavior was seen before the DPF patch was applied to the AI SIT environment.

Here is a selection of the errors I have been seeing while trying to run the OTM ingest for the DRADIS Post Install/V&V:

[ERROR] Async loop died!
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException
at backtype.storm.utils.DisruptorQueue.consumeBatchToCursor (DisruptorQueue java:128) - [storm-core-0.9.4.jar:0.9.4]
at ...

And:

HdfsFileSystem [ERROR] Exception when attempting to list files
java.io.IOException: Filesystem closed
...

If you let the errors stew overnight you can also see:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.yammer.metrics.Metrics at kafka.metrics.KafkaMetricsGroup$class.newTimer(KafkaMetricsGroup.scala:85) at kafka.consumer.FetchRequestAndR

And:

java.laong.ExceptionInInitializerError at kafka.metrics.KafkaMetricsGroup$class.newTimer(KafkaMetricsGroup.scala:85) at kafka.consumer.FetchRequestAndResponseMetrics.newTimer(FetchRequestAndResponseS

Note that the ccg ingest and the ais ingests are working just fine. It's only the otm ingest that is failing.
item.summary: DRADIS: OTM ingest breaks Streaming DPF topology

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Assigning to Refugio Delgado for now so that he can assign it to the applicable individual.

Used data from OTM change history to drive topic and we are now seeing a NPE within StructuredObjects.resolve method. Loosing access to this system for a few weeks so will not be able to close until AI SIT system is available.
Will be started when AI SIT "system" is available.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7289] Island network: web2/geoserver running out of ram and resources - getting timeouts
item.description:
On the AFL network we are seeing jboss timeout issues for the tools running on the geoserver VM.

When we have 1 or more ROMA/Rigors clients querying geoserver (minimum of 7 calls every 10 seconds) and is typically more - this is per person logged in and using roma.

When this is coupled with MPS calls to get tracks, we see MPS errors (e.g. no tracks), we see out of memory errors, etc. Further observation - we see calls to MPS taks over 90 seconds to complete when the calls to the rigors layers are occuring.

We also see 'socket timeout' errors when other widgets (watchboxes, etc) are trying to query and/or update WFS-T layers.

Would it be possible to possibly tune the geoserver resources or move the rigors layers to another VM?
item.summary: Island network: web2/geoserver running out of ram and resources - getting timeouts

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Severity 3 - Defect causes failure of noncritical aspects of the system.

Now select a different track in the watch-list. This selects that track on the map but unfortunately does not de-select the old track.

However, at steady state when the bluesky websocket is established and get disconnected, then things work fine, the timestamp is correct.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7313] 2-phase loading in TrackList (part of watch list widget) is annoying to the user
item.description:
If the user has filter enabled in the WatchList's Tracklist table, when the data is loaded, the spinner is displayed while all data is loaded. Once all data is loaded, the filter is applied which causes the spinner to be displayed again. This is annoying.

We want to perform a single query for data once we have the filter.
item.summary: 2-phase loading in TrackList (part of watch list widget) is annoying to the user

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment: Re-open because in PDEC the initial load of tracks is taking too longer. We want to optimize to make sure it issue only 1 call to Geoserver

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7291] User may accidentally promote, edit, delete, email, etc different Collection Mgr entries
item.description:
In Collection Mgr widget, do the following steps.

1. in View/Modify, on page 1, select a row for RIGOR
2. navigate to page 2, don't select anything, now right click on any row that is not RIGOR to delete and select Delete. The confirmation dialog shows "delete RIGOR?" . This implies the deletion is on the row on page 1, but user wants to delete the non-RIGOR on page2.

If the user does not pay attention and read the dialog context throughoutly and select Delete, he'll delete the one on page 1.

Same thing happen on Edit, View and other context menus. It's editing the wrong entry.

May want to clear row selection on page navigation.
item.summary: User may accidentally promote, edit, delete, email, etc different Collection Mgr entries

comments.comment:
After thinking this over, this issue is more a unified grid fix that will indirectly fix this bug for the Col Mgnt and other widgets also.
Currently when the user right click on a the unified grid to bring up the context menu, it does not select the clicked row. We want to the unified grid to automatically select the clicked row. This means the context menu will be associated with the clicked row.

When applied the update to Col Mgnt, it will ensure the Delete, Promote, etc operations are applied to the correct row.

This will benefit the alert manager, watchlist, tracklist, VOI, MFI case manager widgets also.
completion date is set to 4/5 since I will be on PTO 3/28 to 4/3

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7328] Need dots-mode for map
item.description:
Need a "dots-mode" for the map. Two ways to activate it:
1. global setting: button at bottom of map
2. filter setting: right-click a filter to bring up context-menu to toggle on/off dots-mode for that filter... if on, it overrides the icon from MPS/CGSS

The dots can be the color of the label.
Extra Credit: the dots would be the "dot color" specified in Weaver DRE, which MPS should be passing along. Not sure MPS is transmitting this yet, but if it is, then try using that color instead of the label color
item.summary: Need dots-mode for map

item.description:
In using the Aeolus map and using the history buttons, the following functionality was noticed.
1) Not sure if this is the desired behavior (if yes, then this item is not a bug)
Clicking 'Toggle track history trail line.' button does not always generate an updated call to geoserver.

  • Select track with history
  • Select 'Toggle track history trail line.' button (button spins and WFS request made)

  • Select 'Toggle track history trail line.' button (turns green line back on but no WFS query made).

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7108] Add feature-counts to each filter in Map TOC
item.description:
e.g.
Merchant Track [10021, 230]
Hostile Track [1300, 120]
Friendly Track [40111, 4500]

The first number is the total features available that matches the filter (MPS should be able to give this to us).
The second number is the total features visible in the current viewport.
item.summary: Add feature-counts to each filter in Map TOC

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Estimated "points" remaining: 13. Uncertainty in this number because much of this will depend on MPS modifications that FSI would do, not UFS.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7131] Need way for UFS to access entities independently of tracks
item.description: We need a database of entities, whether we have tracks on them or not. If we could make a feature-layer out of the entities in the KB, we'd have it I think. We'd use SCONUM as their unique ID. Basically our watch-list (and the VOI list from S2A as well) should be referencing entities. If the entity we're "watching" suddenly goes MFI then indeed we don't have a current track anymore (it's "missing" after all) so we need a way to still have a handle to the entity and its KB data. Basically our WatchList widget is, right now, holding track IDs so if the track goes missing our WatchList complains it can't find the trackID it's holding. It really needs to hold entity IDs (SCONUMs?) and then be able to fetch them from the proposed entity-layer in GeoServer (or I guess do SPARQL to the KB??? which probably isn't too fun from a widget).
item.summary: Need way for UFS to access entities independently of tracks

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7360] Allow users to delete multiple watchboxes at once
item.description:
the watchbox UI widget only allow deletion of one watchbox at a time. If we have dozen of watchboxes while testing, it's very cumbersome and time consuming

1. we need to add a multi-delete REST api to the ufswatchbox crud service.
2. enhance the watchbox UI to allow this feature.
item.summary: Allow users to delete multiple watchboxes at once

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Jeff, made this a Pri 4. I'm not sure this is needed for FCR-0.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7311] Allow user to delete dynamically-created ImageryLayers
item.description:
METOC and ROMA layers can be dynamically added to the map ImageryLayers panel when using those widgets. But once the layers have been added they cannot be removed until the map has restarted.

Add another menu option to the right-click on ImageryLayers. Right now we have a single menu item to adjust the transparency. This would be another menu item.
item.summary: Allow user to delete dynamically-created ImageryLayers

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7309] Refactor Sketch tree to use jsTree
item.description: The Sketch tree is still using the old C2RPC/MTC2SOA GWT code. It needs to be ported to the DCGS-N Inc 2 UFS pattern-and-practice which uses jsTree (e.g. in Bookmarks).
item.summary: Refactor Sketch tree to use jsTree

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Scope has changed to now create a unified grid first and then use the unified grid to create the sketch tree. The points have been adjusted to reflect the efforts of both subtasks.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7310] Add sketch OVLY2 import/export to map/sketch capability
item.description: Bring over from C2RPC (MTC2 SOA) the COA Sketch / GCCS OVLY import/export capability.
item.summary: Add sketch OVLY2 import/export to map/sketch capability

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7335] Provide indication that tracks have been hidden from the map
item.description:
HSI finding HSI-269: "Provide indication that tracks have been hidden from the map."

There is currently no visual indication when a track has been hidden. UFS recommends putting a badge on the hide button if any tracks have been hidden. When the user clicks the unhide-all button, the badge would be removed (and the hidden tracks would be revealed again).
item.summary: Provide indication that tracks have been hidden from the map

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7368] Reword confirmation message when deleting track from watch-list & switch ok/cancel order
item.description:
Currently says, "Delete Track Confirmation". Should say, "Delete Track from Watch List Confirmation"

Also switch the OK/Cancel buttons order in all modals so that the OK button is on the left and the Cancel is on the right. do this in the ufscommon and apply it to all widgets that have modals
item.summary: Reword confirmation message when deleting track from watch-list & switch ok/cancel order

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7370] Watch List Carousel cards should have dark-grey background
item.description: The current white background for the carousel cards does not provide enough contrast for the icons typically used. Needs to be dark-grey.
item.summary: Watch List Carousel cards should have dark-grey background

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7404] Set S2A VOI Entry Visibility From Security Level
item.description: The S2A VOI list entries contain a sub-object of type securityLevel. The securityLevel object has an attribute named " label with a value of the Capco string. This Capco string can be used to compute the visibility string.
item.summary: Set S2A VOI Entry Visibility From Security Level

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [DCGSNSAFE-7405] enable tooltip in imagery layer panel
item.description: • Update METOC imagery layer tooltips to align with MTC2 widget's layer description.
item.summary: enable tooltip in imagery layer panel
